title: Fallout Style Pipboy map of Madison, WI
description: This is a map of State Street in Madison, WI, styled after the map in Fallout video games. The design mimics the retro-futuristic aesthetic of the Pipboy.

title: Map of the Doolittle Raid (1942)
description: This map visualizes one of the most daring air missions in U.S. history — the Doolittle Raid. On April 18, 1942, sixteen B-25 bombers launched from the USS Hornet to strike Tokyo in retaliation for the attack on Pearl Harbor. The map traces the aircrafts’ route across the Pacific, illustrating the mission’s unprecedented range, the crews’ crash landings in China, and its symbolic importance as America’s first air operation to hit Japan’s mainland. The design combines historical cartography and storytelling to capture both the geography and the gravity of the mission.

title: Minimalist Map of Wisconsin
description: This map was created for the #30DayMapChallenge theme “Minimal.” It features the Geo-Metro linework from Daniel P. Huffman’s Project Linework, a creative library of experimental vector geometries.

title: Total Solar Eclipse 2125
description: Created for the #30DayMapChallenge theme “A Map from 2125,” this piece visualizes the path of totality for the solar eclipse of October 26, 2125 using NASA’s eclipse prediction data.

title: 2016 Milwaukee US Senate Election Results
description: For today’s map, I explored the Milwaukee Open Data Portal to find an interesting dataset to visualize. One of the first things that caught my eye was the 2016 U.S. Senate race results by Milwaukee voting wards. With election mapping being such an important niche within cartography, I decided to take a crack at replicating a Vox-style election map using this local data. In 2010, Ron Johnson defeated three-term Democratic senator Russ Feingold by a margin of about 5 percentage points. In their 2016 rematch, Johnson once again won by roughly the same margin. By 2022, Johnson secured his third term by just one percentage point, and he currently remains in office. Despite this map showing Feingold’s overwhelming victory within the city of Milwaukee, he ultimately lost the statewide race.

title: Bermuda Triangle - The Third Dimension
description: One of my favorite parts of this challenge is seeing the many creative directions people take with each theme. It’s always inspiring to scroll through the feed and see how differently everyone interprets the same prompt. For today’s theme: Dimensions, I decided to take that idea a bit literally. I present to you my map of the Bermuda Triangle, a place often referred to as a gateway to another dimension. It was fun to lean into the myth and mystery for this one and explore a theme that sits somewhere between geography and legend.

title: Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore Postcard
description: For today's map, I ceated a post-card style collage from my trip to Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore with Nicole Mitchell. I wanted to experiment outside of ArcGIS Pro for this one. The trail lines are GPX files exported from Strava from our hikes and paddling routes. I then brought th emap into inkscape for further editing before finishing it in Canva, where I added the photos and text.

title: Treaty of Paris
description: This treaty formally recognized the independence of the United States and established its boundaries , stretching from the Atlantic Ocean to the Mississippi River, and from Canada to Spanish Florida. For today’s map, I explored historical boundary files of the United States and tried my best to replicate the style of maps from that era. I had a lot of fun experimenting with this design and seeing how the U.S. evolved over time.

title: Treasures of Oz
theme: Atlas of Natual Areas in Ozaukee County
description: This interactive site was created by Joseph Willman, a freelance cartographer and GIS specialist, as an independent project inspired by the Treasures of Oz website. While not affiliated with the Treasures of Oz, this project was developed to showcase the abundant natural areas of Ozaukee County.

title: Driftless Hillshade with Blender
description: This is my first attempt at creating a realistic hillshade using Blender and GIS data. The Driftless Area in southwestern Wisconsin was chosen for its distinctive topography, which lacks glacial deposits and features deeply carved river valleys.

title: Driftless Hillshade with Blender (colored)
description: This is my first attempt at coloring a realistic hillshade using Blender and GIS data. The Driftless Area in southwestern Wisconsin was chosen for its distinctive topography, which lacks glacial deposits and features deeply carved river valleys.

title: Mississippi Blues Trail
description: This interactive site was created by Joseph Willman, a freelance cartographer and GIS specialist, as an independent project inspired by the Mississippi Blues Trail. While not affiliated with the Mississippi Blues Commission, this project was developed to showcase both the historical and cultural importance of the trail.

title: Lakeshore Nature Preserve Birding Tour
description: An interactive birding walking tour of the Lakeshore Nature Preserve on the UW–Madison campus, highlighting key stops and species with photos and narrative context.

title: American Climate Change Survey
description: Choropleth map visualizing U.S. opinions on climate change using survey data and Python-generated pie charts within the map for regional comparisons.

title: Coordinated Climate Visualization
description: A D3.js map and chart combination showing climate data in an interactive, linked-view design to explore spatial-temporal trends.

title: Length of Day in U.S. Counties
description: Map showing the variation in daylight duration across U.S. counties for the summer and winter solstices, calculated using Python and ArcGIS Pro.

title: Adirondack Fire Towers
description: A map of historic fire towers in the Adirondack Park, symbolized by type and elevation, celebrating New York’s mountain fire tower legacy.

title: Great Range Wilderness Map
description: A detailed wilderness map highlighting trails, campsites, and peaks in the Great Range of the Adirondacks, part of a larger High Peaks series.

title: Great Wisconsin Birding & Nature Trail
description: An interactive Leaflet map visualizing birding and nature sites across Wisconsin, adapted from the Great Wisconsin Birding & Nature Trail guide.

title: Ozaukee Interurban Trail Birding Guide
description: Interactive guide mapping hotspots and accessibility features along the 30-mile Ozaukee Interurban Trail through diverse habitats of Ozaukee County.

title: Adirondack Size Comparison
description: A simple map comparing the area of the Adirondack Park to the state of Vermont to visualize its vast scale.

title: ANWR at Risk: Oil Leases & Caribou Calving Grounds
description: Map of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge showing proposed oil-lease areas overlapping Porcupine caribou calving grounds, illustrating conservation trade-offs.

title: Numbered vs Unnumbered Roads in Wisconsin
description: Binary map highlighting numbered and unnumbered road patterns across Wisconsin, exploring naming conventions and regional distribution.

title: Watercolor Map of Penang, Malaysia
description: A watercolor-style tribute map to Penang’s colorful architecture, inspired by John Nelson’s technique and created as a personalized art gift.

title: Russian Occupation in Georgia
description: Map illustrating Russian-occupied regions of Abkhazia and South Ossetia within Georgia, raising awareness of the continuing territorial conflict.

title: The Green Divide: Unequal Access to Green Space in Chicago
description: Story map exploring inequitable distribution of green space in Chicago, combining historical redlining and park accessibility data.

title: Summiting Tahawus (Mt. Marcy)
description: A hillshade-styled topographic map commemorating the 16-mile ascent of New York’s tallest peak, capturing the terrain and experience.

title: Wisconsin Accessible Birding Atlas
description: Interactive atlas for accessible birding across Wisconsin, allowing filters by site accessibility and resources for inclusive outdoor recreation.

title: Vintage Wicker Park Map
description: Vintage-styled map of Wicker Park in Chicago, inspired by Central Park planning maps and 19th-century aesthetics.

title: Knobstone Trail Thru-Hike
description: Minimalist grayscale trail map of the Knobstone Trail thru-hike, incorporating dot grid reference and stylized hillshading.

title: Scroll Map of Known Lands
description: A scrolling, medieval-inspired map blending cartography and storytelling, styled with parchment textures and castle symbology.
